posts.post_content: I went up against one of these at the prerelease. Way more effective then I thought he would be, since he can essentially zerg rush any one of your creatures. Even big hitters like Godsire can only take on four of those wolves. Very good card.

Posted By: ColossusofSardia (7/29/2009 11:49:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This guy begs to splash white for [Mark of Asylum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mark of Asylum). Being able to save your wolves after the "Arena" effect is really nice. [Harm's Way](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harm's Way) works well for this as well.  
  
Finally, this guy is amazing in casual legacy with [Serra's Blessing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra's Blessing). Gives all your wolves Vigilance...lets you swing and suicide for maximum puppy damage.  
  
This guy is really good with the original [Master of the Hunt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master of the Hunt) if you use the new rules for "Bands with Other".
posts.html:
This guy begs to splash white for Mark of Asylum. Being able to save your wolves after the "Arena" effect is really nice. Harm's Way works well for this as well.

Finally, this guy is amazing in casual legacy with Serra's Blessing. Gives all your wolves Vigilance...lets you swing and suicide for maximum puppy damage.

This guy is really good with the original Master of the Hunt if you use the new rules for "Bands with Other".

Posted By: kitsunewarlock (8/14/2009 12:11:55 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I played him recently in a draft (my first pack, he was the rare AND the foil... and one of the uncommons was Overrun!) and he's surprisingly brutal even in limited without support from other Wolf cards. He's total [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) bait, which is annoying, but can be turned to your advantage. [Illusionary Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Illusionary Servant) air forces are brutal in limited, and his ability just murders them.  
  
A great trick is that it's totally fair game to block with your wolves and then sic them on an unblocked creature... just unfair. Throw a [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) on him if you want him to live, though.
posts.html:
I played him recently in a draft (my first pack, he was the rare AND the foil... and one of the uncommons was Overrun!) and he's surprisingly brutal even in limited without support from other Wolf cards. He's total Doom Blade bait, which is annoying, but can be turned to your advantage. Illusionary Servant air forces are brutal in limited, and his ability just murders them.

A great trick is that it's totally fair game to block with your wolves and then sic them on an unblocked creature... just unfair. Throw a Whispersilk Cloak on him if you want him to live, though.
